title: Research and Markets: The Future of Americas Oil and Gas Exploration and Production Industry to 2020 - H2 2015 Report
text:
Related Content 
DUBLIN--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- 
Research and Markets ( http://www.researchandmarkets.com/research/f98f3w/the_future_of ) has announced the addition of the "The Future of Americas Exploration and Production Industry to 2020 (H2 2015)" report to their offering. 
This report analyses the future of Americas exploration and production industry. The report provides complete details of growth opportunities in the industry along with current status of E&P activities in each country. Outlook of the industry amidst declining oil prices and firm stance of OPEC countries and declining activities in the US shale exploration are detailed in the report. 
Exploration blocks available as of 2015 and forecast of oil and gas production by countries are provided in the research work. Details of production in all major oil and gas fields across Americas are provided in detail. 
Revenues, capex and reserves of top 5 oil and gas companies are provided in the report along with their detailed upstream operations and SWOT analysis. Market structure of oil and gas production is provided for each of the existing upstream countries in Americas. 
Key Findings US Reapproves Exploration in Arctic Sea as a part of national energy strategy Canada's East Coast Attracting Investments from Global Exploration Companies Mexico Delays a Few Deep Water Oil Exploration Projects amidst low oil prices Brazil annual daily production from the pre-salt grew almost 12 times between 2010 and 2014 Americas Exploration Blocks Open for Bidding, 2015 OPEC to Remain firm in its strategy despite fall in oil prices Estimated oil and gas prices, 2015 Americas oil reserves to last 58 years at current production rates Americas Upstream Competitive Landscape Oil and gas production from large fields across Americas
